Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the actions of Donald Trump on September 11, 2001, by stating that he carried victims over his shoulders down the steps of the burning World Trade Center.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that Barack Obama was not the president on September 11, 2001, as he was serving in the Illinois State Senate at that time.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks sufficient evidence or support to prove that Donald Trump performed the actions described on September 11, 2001.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the provided image of Barack Obama sitting in the Oval Office with his feet on the desk watching basketball is real, when in fact, it has been doctored.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim fails to consider the alternative explanation that the image of Barack Obama was taken during a meeting with his national security adviser and other officials, not while watching basketball.
Falters at times: The claim falters by attributing actions to Donald Trump that are not supported by historical records or eyewitness accounts.
Understate: There is no evidence of understatement bias in the provided claim.
